bow: motherhood is lonely could elaborate but just do feel like it sure lot of you can relate 100 especially as sahm yes am sahm right there with you sahm and we moved to new city just under three months ago swim lessons are the most interaction have outside of running errands it incredibly isolating work full time and it still lonely try some podcasts ve worked alone for 17 years prior to sahm and it helped me lot you don sound happy reach out if you need help to me other redditors doctor or counsellor ve just started searching for mother and baby group and am going to give it go next week only months in but can imagine the loneliness only getting harder it isolating spending your day with someone who can talk back and achieving so little in day that you haven got much to talk about to anyone you aren alone though promise xx this resonates with me hang in there momma would say not happy do feel depressed or anything like that just felt lonlier than normal this morning and posted to reach out to others having responses like this always helps thank you having someone who really understands as in another mom is so important expecting my 7th and have been through each phase from the constant breastfeeding and glued to baby right the way to getting past the surly teenage stage it easy to not care for yourself and easy to forget that you are woman in your own right and not just mom nurture yourself as best as you can agree 100 single mom working full time my entire life is going back and forth from my job and being mom it lonely have no time for friends for myself for anything just so tired you re not alone mama it hard hardest job in the world yes yes yes you must have the patience of saint hell yeah it is finally into the ve got my life back phase my lil dude is have good mum friends work part time and little dude loves hanging out with granny amp grandad social time podcasts and 24 nature documentaries on tv helped me so much in the first few years same sahm in new city with month old ve tried prayer groups and mops but it hard when it his nap time and focused on him the whole time also feel needy because of what ve been through although would not say depressed or unhappy but feel like the other ladies can sense it no connections as of yet but ll try again of course im currently sahp nonbinary and ive never been lonelier all my interaction is with my lo and my so and just moved here from 900 miles away struggle socially big time but would do anything for even one mom friend locally just to chat with or vent to ve got nothin yep my oldest started preschool this year at the ymca and it has made my life so much better workout and put my baby in childwatch and even met mom friend spent the first years as samh completely alone when did you start to feel like you had your life back struggling with this as my month old uses my nipple as binky all night long hoping that he will cooperate with my goal to wean around 18 months and that weaning will help me feel like have my own life my oldest is my baby is 10 months being mom is lonely always thought when my oldest started school we make friends but he has autism high functioning and has no interest in making friends thought about joining local moms group but bit socially awkward and do even remember how to make friends unless you know some other moms who like to play games in their spare time my thoughts exactly although ve read study that says it gets easier after having four do want to find out of that is true or not how old are your children child found motherhood very isolating for the first couple of years especially since was the first of our friend group to get pregnant but once my daughter turned or we started making tons of friends mostly from the park or from daycare have huge network of no friends now my kids are and now and honestly more socially active than ever before in my life my advice is to make park routine and you ll start seeing the same people there at the same times chat them up and make some friends that way 37 weeks pregnant and already feel this my baby hasn been born yet and ve been feeling the loneliness for months already feel this mom friend and were talking about how we feel like we re in phase of our lives where we ve lost our identities still make time for myself read actual books for me have hobbies can do at home it still so isolating and so much of my life revolves around work or being mom mo old sahm torn between diciding to go back to school or work had to stay home because of the daycare cost have few friends but do see them much because so busy with lo off school right now and pregnant begged my husband not to get off the phone on his way home from work today because was so lonely and just wanted to hear someone voice feel for you when go back to school ll be cramming my classes into days week to maximize my time at home hoping that ll be enough interaction to combat the loneliness it going to get lot better once your baby is bit older and durable enough for some independent play at the park not the most social person but it is so easy to strike up conversation with other moms or dads at the park never took advantage of this but look in your area for library story time or moms and toys play groups wish had started building my mom connections sooner but better late than never good luck with the decision of whether to go back to school if you re looking for tips call the talkers in my family my fil and grandmother and put them on speakerphone and let them chat away about their every thought while clean the house or put on podcasts tv just to have some noise also have lengthy watch later list on youtube to play through ve been lonely work from home person for several years not who you asked but personally felt like had life again around year 15 months in and it definitely feels easier each month we still nurse lot but she has calmed down the with all night nursing for the most part we cosleep and she spends much of the night rolled away from me which helps tremendously at months this was definitely not the case oh and after year started to magically lose some baby weight that was hanging on guess because we are nursing less anyway that also helped ton in feeling like had my life back because feel much more physically like my old self wonder about that too my grandma had and she said the first baby was the hardest that surprised me it really is thought pregnancy was isolating but being mom is far more lonely at times was sahm up up until now am in nursing school which has made it both lonelier and less lonely just more of different type of lonely all of my friends are having kids yet and while hanging out with them can be helpful it also sometimes makes me feel even further isolated some days it really feels like there is no way around it especially now that am single mom it definitely is it kinda sad maybe but get lot of support from my online bumper group and actually am meeting up with one girl in my area for library story time thing but at 15 months it just now feeling easier to even attempt to get out and do stuff we are down to one nap and things are way more edible because of that remember around maybe months talked to this same person and we were like yeah we should totally meet up and it never happened like ok so tired the baby sleeps every two hours so when would be the best time oh and she hates the car seat and it so much work to go anywhere but now it lot easier that they can walk and are slightly more interested in music classes and story times and stuff it still not like ve even made any friends but even just getting out and talking to other moms makes me feel little better had friend over the other day and we were talking having good time out of nowhere she says wow it must suck so much to be alone all the time with no one to talk to it brought me down little bit to be honest yes its lonely and when you finally are with people its like you dont know how to talk anymore one is scary because of the unknown two is scary because you wonder how you ll handle two kids but it easier because you know what coming three and above seems like it ll be impossible but for me three or above isn what you imagine it to be holidays are never quiet and we are always busy but it really is lovely and honestly our family motto is if every *one* does little no *one* has to do lot teamwork makes things run smoothly but equally brings real closeness thank you having big family was like zen master class in perfecting patience there an app called peanut it helped me find some local friends sending you love this have listened to soooo many last podcast on the left episodes since having my son lol it helped me survive the cluster feeding times highly recommend the peanut app it like tinder for moms ve met mom friends this way and it been so nice to have others who understand and can relate the peanut app is like tinder for moms found mom friends this way we ve done yoga without the kids and play dates with them we are lonely too everyone needs me and it exhausting and you can complain or you re ungrateful see also audiobooks single mom been thinking this most of the day going out alone with an 18 month old gives me anxiety so we just hang out at home lot was the first of my friends to have baby while maternity leave was amazing for bonding with my son it was also one of the loneliest times of my life now that he almost year old it gotten better because can leave once in awhile but there are still times where feel isolated solidarity💜 my 1yo son has listened to so many chick lits he going to be romantic when he gets older from the things he learned soul shockingly lonely the hardest part of motherhood for me by far being house wife is very close second have and my first is still my hardest just downloaded the peanut app thanks for sharing this is not friend those days when you are being pawed at and needed so much by everyone it can be draining and so exhausting hard to smile those days but the days when you are so needed are the days see my mum in desperate need for in her later years this terrifies me sometimes to need this being needed all the time this subreddit makes me feel like am not alone almost seven months in and relate so much miss having an adult to talk to miss socializing even though was very sociable before it really is lonely the only way ve been able to combat this is to go to every toddler child activity in my community as possible it is lonely out there especially if your kid have disabilities think my life would feel super different if we lived around family can relate on every level of this look forward to an adult conversation when my husband gets home from work but all get are grunts and dunno the other day he didn even say hi to me he just went straight to the fridge since he was hungry things like that make me even more frustrated about 20 months husband and had excess emotional energy to spend totally agree live around his family and do not see them much it not that do love them it just that we are super close really miss my parents we are super close but they live in oregon and we live in kansas city removed me too recently in fact and we just moved states so don really have any friends here it hard but it won always be this way and our babies benefit from it greatly keep your chin up mama join moms group freaking saved my sanity and have made wonderful friends that never thought would was so lonely and isolated and now don feel that way at all— it incredible having community who knows how you feel and we can commiserate together just remember that you are important too there is so much pressure surrounding nursing but if it is sucking your soul 12 months is nothing to shake stick at +1 lonely sahm agrees never learned how to drive and the area we live in does have much within walking distance so getting out of the house is usually no go did think it would be this isolating feel you my husband is so mentally drained after working stressful job at start up all day that all he wants to do is watch tv to shut his mind off it depressing to me and so isolating our families live in other states and we ve only been here years so didn put down many roots before becoming sahm miss laughing and talking with my husband but fear that will never happen again my family is hours away feel you there moved to the city in for my husband and the only friend had here moved away it is so depressing introverted so sometimes it isn always awful but normal adult conversation would be nice it not too much to ask is it it does feel nice to vent though ve been getting through song of ice and fire on audible finally and ca wait to get back to lpotl no please do put that in quotes it *is* job very sure you know feel live that being sahm is real job but do like to see women putting themselves and each other down with phrasing like this not considering keeping kids alive to be real job has been imposed on us and it just wrong unfair and condescending it real job and if people care for other people children they re getting paid for it and they do even do all the mental and emotional work nor handle the hassle of laundry cleaning etc if you want you can pm me it not the same as in person friendships but sahm of 6mo and it can get extremely isolating sorry this isn parenting related but can you share the pros and cons of living there if you re up for it specifically for family pls don feel pressured to answer it just place on our list of places to maybe live so lonely never expected it this wasn meant to be condescending at all am sahm myself to 10 month old so believe me know how isolating lonely and hard it is do you have any recommendations ve always been interested in audiobooks but do know where to find them are there free ones yes that part didn see coming wish had sisterwife we use audible which is pay service and in my opinion worth every penny but you can also use overdrive which lets you check out audio books through your library for free mean you could almost count that as an educational activity my husband grandma also had and asked her how she did it and she said parenting is so different today do know if could tried to get her to be more specific but she moved on to different topic am sahm in kansas city mine are and that interesting wonder what she meant think it all relative right we moved from portland or so everything especially housing is more affordable although there has been kind of crazy spike in housing prices here lately there are less things to do here than portland but there are quite bit more than say rural area we have the nelson atkins museum of art free the kansas city zoo which has very reasonable membership rate for residents union station has science city the children museum wonderscope coming soon is rabbithole full emersion story book experience for kids the libraries are wonderful am partial to the downtown and plaza locations kaleidoscope free art experience provided by hallmark cards which is headquartered here the coterie children theater several community centers with open play tons of pools new tunnel indoor play called superkidz world of fun and oceans of fun the sealife aquarium legoland deanna rose farmstead dance lessons sports etc the missouri side does not have the greatest performing neighborhood schools and lot of people choose charters or private which is obviously vicious cycle there is lot of driving stuff is necessarily close but if you are coming from more rural community it will probably feel not to bad like said came from portland and walked everywhere so driving everywhere not so fun for adults there is the power and light district plays concerts westport quite few good restaurant options major and minor league baseball teams football team etc 12 months is completely amazing and is the aap recommendation think it just helpful for me to hear other parents success stories about babies nursing less at night naturally soon after 12 months thanks for this need to remember that lot will still change between now and his first birthday months is long time for development and his sleeping nursing habits may change between now and then thank you ❤️ saw your comment saying your baby is months so is mine let me just add my perspective here in case it helps have an month old and year old two days week my year old goes to full day preschool on those days it is isolating being home with baby all day slave to his naps and don really see anyone now on the days at home with my toddler included it great we go to play dates we see friends we go out and do stuff it so fun have several go to friends with kids the same age and the moms get to chat while the kids play my point is babies are isolating because they re so needy and not social hope as your baby gets older that you will feel less isolated because you re more able to enjoy social activities with the child that how it been for me and have so much more fun now my mom had children my brothers are to years apart she was busy in the early 70s growing up was different and easier on the parent day to day ops my brothers were running wild all day long not care in the world feel as though kids do not do that as often see it with my nieces and nephews they are indoors for most of the day maybe that what her grandmother meant there more pressure on parents now they are under microscope and the liability for their child actions is higher my sil granny had 21 kids single births mind you ouch reddit is great place to vent and one of the reasons on it an introvert too so most days aren that bad but we all need some company now and then check out your library website most public libraries have an ebook eaudiobook service such as overdrive app is libby cloudlibrary hoopla rb digital or some others exactly this ve tried explaining it to childless friends as well as friends with live in partners to help with their shared offspring neither group seems to fully grasp the concept wake up get kiddo ready get myself ready drop him off get full minutes of me time in the car on the way to work work customer service always smiling always helping here to serve yes absolutely yell at me because you read the ad wrong only here to absorb your yells hours later leave work another minutes of me time in the car to decompress from the day pick up kiddo head home dishes laundry vacuum tidy entertain the child dinner bath teeth book bed this is where everyone suggests get genuine me time but good lord exhausted by the time my son is finally asleep every day work full time in store work full time at home almost never get time to myself to do things enjoy when do feel guilty that deprived my child of that time as work so damn much to keep roof over our heads that barely see him interact with adults at work yes but they re not any better than kids get yelled at by idiots minimum 5x per week many many more some weeks they re all so goddamn needy and entitled and that just the customers that does include my dozen or so corporate overlords who are all somehow my boss emailing every day about sales goals and other bullshit outside my control feel like shell of person feel like life is nothing more than clocking in clocking out and cleaning ca maintain friendships all my romantic interests are too busy enjoying their lives to want to be around depressed single mom honestly that the way it went with friends too it just so goddamn lonely sorry for the novel thank you for coming to my ted talk know the group name is mommit so sorry if it for moms only but sahd with year old ve found some great advice here before so not trying to intrude agree with it being lonely for the the last years ve been trying to find my space in the parenthood social landscape to help with the loneliness last year we moved out to the burbs from the city and lost my small group of parents would do things with we go to indoor play places and have signed up for story time music class and go to the park lot in hopes of firstly meeting kids my son can play with and work on his social skills and secondly maybe talk to another parent for bit but get side eyes and fake smiles just the other day my son was playing with another boy at the park and when went to help him up the slide the other boys mom came and moved him to another part of the play ground one of my favorite situations is when was talking to mom about speech therapy her son just started going and my son has been going for bit and mins in her mom friend comes and redirects her attention and takes her away as if she was saving her from weird guy at bar when do come across some dads they are usually on day off from work so never see them again not only does this not help with the loneliness but it not fair to my son who just looking to play with other kids his age now my wife has said that she has been guilty of this when she takes him out but that she does even think about it it just knee jerk reaction from moms view what can do to help with the loneliness agree especially when someone understands the struggle my husband doesn really get it he listens to my concerns when bring them up but don think he hears what trying to say he just gets mad or annoyed that bringing up the bad things he does again so he tunes me out what girl to do especially when you see your friends who haven had kids yet still live their lives you re not as available as before your priorities are all different it hard to maintain the same levels of friendship and you feel yourself drifting apart totally agree am glad nursed for year but did not feel guilty one bit for stopping then honestly think that much longer than most how old is your child am married but work full time with an hour commute honestly that drive time is nice sometimes but mostly just makes me more tired am happily married but tbh still lonely sometimes too he does his thing weekend night video games do mine netflix know if asked him he agree to hang out but to do what too tired to have the interesting conversations we used to have and just want to vege out we don like lot of the same stuff on tv so it not like we can do nothing together don mean to compare my situation to yours single mothers are super heroes in my opinion but just wanted you to know everyone think gets lonely in motherhood no matter the situation and think hope once kids get older and you can do things you both like together it will get better keep strong momma it sounds like you re doing fantastic job look for family friendly fitness club that has on site child care we love ours and last night we attended big 4th of july party with live music and even won the cake decorating contest we swim and wear the kids out and make friends with other families also teach yoga class for mamas and their babies just to give moms way to get out of the house and connect with others was just thinking that my friends do have kids and they only talk about hitting up bars and things of the like breastfeed and not really up for bars and drinking which ve mentioned and suggested other things they simply say yes but no one follows through because they re busy and the other friends have are mine and my husbands friends all males and also about the bar life so my husband gets down time by going to the bar and drinking with the guys prefer not to come home smelling like an ashtray so stay home with our lo maybe once baby is bit older ll be able to find momma for play dates use youtube for some but they sometimes wo have complete series have an affair meee tooo sahm
